[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Secure E-Commerce System (SES) defines requirements for encrypted transactions, secure authentication, automatic session management, and system reliability.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: SES ensures SSL encryption, automatic session logout, secure storage, real-time backups, and compatibility across Windows and Linux environments.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: SES integrates with authentication services, secure databases, backup storage, and encrypted data synchronization.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: SES provides a secure and responsive web UI for login, transactions, and session management.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: SES operates on redundant cloud servers with automatic failover for high availability.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: SES utilizes a React.js frontend, Node.js backend, and PostgreSQL for secure data storage.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: SES ensures TLS 1.3 encryption for all data transmissions.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: SES optimizes real-time data synchronization with distributed backup storage.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: SES manages authentication, transaction security, backup automation, and access control.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: SES supports platform compatibility across Windows and Linux operating systems.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: SES connects to authentication, payment processing, and backup storage APIs.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: SES supports SSL-encrypted transactions, session timeout, secure login/logout, and real-time data backup.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: SES is designed for customers making secure transactions and administrators managing security policies.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: SES requires an active internet connection for authentication and transaction processing.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: SES relies on encrypted authentication, secure API interactions, and real-time backup mechanisms.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Redundant Storage: Backup system ensuring no data loss.
Secure Authentication: Enforced access control using encrypted credentials.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall enforce SSL encryption for all customer transactions.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall support user authentication with encrypted credentials.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall automatically log out inactive users after a predefined period (REQ-FUNC-002).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall prevent cookies from storing user credentials (REQ-INTF-002).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall enforce multi-factor authentication for administrator access (REQ-INTF-83).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide a secure and user-friendly UI for transactions (REQ-INTF-60).

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall ensure secure login and session validation with an average response time of less than 1 second (REQ-FUNC-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall securely store authentication data, transaction logs, and session activity records (REQ-INTF-74).

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall restrict back-end server access to authenticated administrators only.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with security protocols ensuring encryption and data integrity (REQ-FUNC-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall ensure OS compatibility with Windows and Linux.

[SEC] 3. Verification: SSL encryption, authentication, session logout, and redundant storage validated.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User manuals, API security documentation, and session management policies.
[SEC] 5. References: Encryption standards, secure authentication best practices, and backup management guidelines.
